item.title: Pokemon GO: How To Get Scorbunny, Raboot, & Cinderace (Can They Be Shiny)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Get Scorbunny In Pokemon GO?
  • Pokemon GO: How To Get Raboot And Cinderace?
  • Pokemon GO: Can Scorbunny, Raboot, And Cinderace Be Shiny?

You can get a Scorbunny in Pokemon GO from the start of the Max Out Season. In addition, both of its evolutions, Raboot and Cinderace, along with other Galar Pokemon also debuted. Scorbunny and its evolutions were among some of the most awaited monsters in the game.

The September 3, 2024, GO All Out event debuts Scorbunny, Raboot, and Cinderace. While there are multiple ways of encountering a Scorbunny in Pokemon GO , you can only get Raboot and Cinderace through evolution. Events that feature the monster increase your chances of encountering one; you might get a High IV Scorbunny. Many are also looking for their Shiny variants and this guide details everything.

How To Get Scorbunny In Pokemon GO?

Scorbunny is a Fire-type Pokemon and its maximum Pokemon GO CP of 1240. Its stat spread comprises 132 ATK, 79 DEF, and 137 STA, which makes it an average fighter. But the monster’s overall power and damage output increases once you evolve it.

There are various ways of encountering a Scorbunny; you can get it in the wild, complete Research tasks, and by hatching in-game Eggs. While you can directly encounter a Scorbunny, Raboot, and Cinderance are only available through evolution. Niantic might add other ways to encounter Raboot and Cinderance.

Pokemon GO: Get Scorbunny In The Wild

While Scorbunny is a wild Pokemon, events featuring the monster can increase its wild spawn rate. You can boost the wild Scorbunny spawn rate even more by strategically using different items. Pokemon GO Incense, Lure Modules, and the Weather Boost effect can significantly increase wild Pokemon spawn rate. Here are the steps to boost Scorbunny’s wild spawn rate during featured events.

  • Find a PokeStop within sunny weather areas
  • Attach a Lure Module
  • Activate an Incense
  • Traverse the area of effect
  • Numerous wild Scorbunny will spawn

Pokemon GO: Get Scorbunny By Completing Research Tasks

You can get a Scorbunny by completing specific Research tasks. In-game content like the GO All Out 2024 Research quests reward Scorbunny encounters after completion. Unlike the wild encounters, you will get a guaranteed Scorbunny encounter upon completing the Research tasks.

Pokemon GO: Get Scorbunny By Hatching Eggs

In addition to the wild and Research tasks, Scorbunny can also hatch from Pokemon GO Eggs. You can hatch a Scorbunny through 5 KM Eggs . There is a high chance of a Scorbunny hatching during events featuring it.

Pokemon GO: How To Get Raboot And Cinderace?

Once you catch a Scorbunny, you can then evolve it into a Raboot and then Cinderace. The only requirement for evolution is Pokemon GO Candy.

  • Evolve Scorbunny into a Raboot: 25 Scorbunny Candy
  • Evolve Raboot into a Cinderace: 100 Scorbunny Candy

Pokemon GO: Can Scorbunny, Raboot, And Cinderace Be Shiny?

Many are wondering if you can encounter a Shiny Scorbunny in Pokemon GO , as well as Shiny variants of its evolutions. Although you can get Scorbunny, Raboot, and Cinderace, their Shiny variants haven’t debuted yet. It is a rare occurrence for Regular Pokemon and their Shiny variants to debut on the same event or day. The developers at Niantic may release Shiny Scorbunny, Shiny Raboot, and Shiny Cinderace in future events.

item.title: Fields Of Mistria: How To Get Tea
item.description:
Tea is one of many different crops to grow and delight budding farmers and tea fans alike in Fields of Mistria . However, tea is also one of Fields of Mistria 's best crops as a potent cooking ingredient that's fantastic for making recipes with some of the best stamina stats. While there are many cups of tea recipes and consumables you can buy, you'll probably only come across tea as a crop in Valen's Request for Tea quest , who wants some to restock his dwindling supplies.

Tea is also a profitable crop with various uses in Fields of Mistria , so it's one worth taking the time to grow. However, there are a few things to do before you can get tea in Fields of Mistria , including completing several story quests. It's also only possible to get hold of tea leaves during one particular season.

How To Get Tea In Fields Of Mistria (Request For Tea Quest)

To get tea in Fields of Mistria , you must buy and grow bags of tea seeds from the General Store . However, you must first upgrade the General store in Fields of Mistria 's Repair the General Store quest, which becomes available after completing the following quests:

  • The Mill Restoration Project
  • Beautification Project

To upgrade the General Store , you need:

  • x5 Copper Ingot
  • x5 Iron Ingot
  • x500 Stone
  • x300 Wood
  • 3,000 Tesserae

Once upgraded, you can buy bags of tea seeds from the General Store for 300 Tesserae each. This might sound pricey, but tea is a summer crop that re-grows once harvested every three days once it reaches maturity, making it a solid investment.

It takes five days for tea leaves to fully mature into a tea plant you can harvest in Fields of Mistria . Therefore, it's worth upgrading the General Store to get tea as soon as possible during the summer. It might also be possible to buy tea from Balor's cart when it shows up in stock.

What Is Tea For In Fields Of Mistria?

Once you've harvested at least one tea in Fields of Mistria , you can return to Valen to turn in the Request for Tea quest for a decent reward of 270 Tesserae . However, tea also has several other uses in Fields of Mistria , as detailed below:

  • You can sell tea you've grown for 135 Tesserae each, making it a profitable crop to make money.
  • You can use tea to make various recipes when cooking in Fields of Mistria like Roasted Rice Tea . Growing and harvesting tea enables you to cook recipes great for restoring health and stamina when consumed, like Tea with Lemon and Green Tea , which is ideal for exploring the Mines.
  • You can also make tea recipes as gifts for NPCs, many appreciating its delights.

You can find and buy other tea recipes from events like Fields of Mistria 's Spring Festival and the Saturday Market, such as Floral Tea and Rose Tea from Maple's stall at the Spring Festival, plus Jasmine Tea and more from Darcy's Saturday Market shop. You can also get tea as a reward by completing certain quests, such as the Tea with Hayden quest, which gives you Tea with Lemon as a reward. Balor's cart also sometimes stocks cups of tea to purchase.

item.title: Entertaining Skyrim Clip Shows What Happens When the World Is on the Player's Side
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • A Skyrim players shares their epic encounters involving a vampire, giant, and dragon showing up simultaneously.
  • The game includes diverse races and creatures, creating notable events when they're encountered together.
  • Players can expect surprises in Skyrim, such as unexpected alliances between creatures due to a common enemy, like vampires.

In the vast world of Bethesda's The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim , anything is possible, which is what one player found out recently during an epic encounter between a vampire, a giant, and a dragon. Skyrim is filled to the brim with different races to play as and creatures to battle against, which is why meeting a handful of them together in the wilds is a notable event.

Released in 2011, The Elder Scrolls ’ fifth main installment in the series succeeded 2006’s Oblivion and is set in the titular snowy region. Players assume the role of the Dragonborn and must attempt to slay the dragon, Alduin the World-Eater. Skyrim is one of the biggest open-world games and takes a long time to beat, and thanks to its scale, players are forever finding spectacles to share with the community.

Posted by DeadStormPirate on Reddit, an 18-second clip of Skyrim gameplay showed a Dragonborn encountering an Ancient Vampire in the wilds. “Why you should always be aware of your surroundings,” accompanied the video, explaining the sudden arrival of a giant and the dragon, Vuljonaak, to assist in the vampire’s defeat. The Skyrim subreddit community was convinced all creatures of the realm hate vampires, offering one reason why they showed up as allies. Others initiated “a vampire, a giant, and a dragon walk into a bar” joke, but ultimately, the video demonstrated what happens when the world is on the Dragonborn's side.

Skyrim Player Has an Epic Encounter Battling a Vampire

Players can choose to walk the Vampire path in the Dawnguard DLC, gaining several advantages such as Skyrim ’s Vampire Seduction ability. Since Vampirism is considered a disease in the game, it's no surprise why other creatures, like the giant and the dragon, would want to see the vamps expelled. However, the community also made the original poster aware that despite the giant and dragon becoming allies against the vampire, the Dragonborn would likely have to face them as enemies afterward.

Witnessing epic encounters, like the user’s vampire massacre, and discovering hidden details within the open world are other instances that Elder Scrolls fans are accustomed to. Recently, another Skyrim player found a ghost flag glitch near Arcwind Point that baffled the community, and gaining other players' perspectives on these occurrences has intellectual and often comical gain for the player experiencing them.

The fifth installment of the franchise has been going strong for over 10 years, and players are turning to Skyrim ’s upcoming Skywind mod for a flurry of new features to keep the content fresh. With a release date yet to be determined, the mod will feature a port of the Vvardenfell island into Skyrim , designed to bring Morrowind into the modern age.

item.title: Deadlock: McGinnis Build Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Play McGinnis In Deadlock
  • Deadlock McGinnis Item Build
  • Deadlock McGinnis Skills And Leveling Order

McGinnis is Deadlocks's attempt at an Engineer-style character. She deploys turrets, healing beacons, and walls to disrupt enemies, and she has her chaingun and homing missiles to bring the pain. She's one of the best laners in the game, and if played well, she can shove friendly Troopers straight into the enemy's base with little effort.

Due to her simple but effective kit, McGinnis is easily one of the best heroes for Deadlock beginners. However, if you want to take full advantage of her skillset, you'll need to know what items to buy, what abilities to prioritize, and how to play her according to her strengths and weaknesses. This guide covers all of these to help you bring the best out of McGinnis.

This guide is for Deadlock's early development build playtest. Things may change as the game is updated.

How To Play McGinnis In Deadlock

Pros

Cons

  • Strong split pushing power
  • High AOE damage with Ultimate
  • Good battlefield control with Spectral Wall
  • Can heal herself and teammates

  • Little-to-no burst damage
  • Starts with 2 Stamina

McGinnis excels at creating kill zones via her walls and turrets . She doesn't have as much chasing power someone as Deadlock heroes like Paradox, but fighting McGinnis in territory that she's locked down is extremely difficult without a significant lead. This makes her a very good split pusher, as she can often handle one or two enemies at once, as long as she has turrets to help her out.

General Tips

  • Place turrets on high ground or in places with clear sightlines
  • Use your wall to split enemy heroes and minions
  • Use your Ultimate liberally to quickly push waves or farm neutral creep camps

Deadlock McGinnis Item Build

Weapon

Vitality

Spirit

Early Game

  • Basic Magazine
  • Headshot Booster

  • Extra Stamina
  • Enduring Spirit
  • Sprint Boots

  • Extra Charge

Core Build

  • Fleetfoot
  • Slowing Bullets
  • Intensifying Magazine
  • Soul Shredder Bullets

  • Extra Stamina
  • Enduring Speed
  • Enduring Spirit (sell later)
  • Spirit Lifesteal (sell later)

  • Extra Charge
  • Mystic Vulnerability
  • Improved Cooldown (turrets)
  • Mystic Slow

Late Game

  • Fleetfoot
  • Slowing Bullets
  • Intensifying Magazine
  • Soul Shredder Bullets

  • Inhibitor
  • Superior Stamina
  • Enduring Speed
  • Improved Spirit/Bullet Armor

  • Rapid Recharge
  • Superior Cooldown
  • Mystic Slow
  • Escalating Exposure

Flex Slots

  • Heroic Aura
    • For buffing minions and turrets

  • Active Reload (early)
    • For quick ammo refills

  • Titanic Magazine (late)
    • More bullets, more damage

  • Fortitude
    • Buy if your turrets need more HP

  • Healbane
    • If enemy has too much healing

  • Echo Shard
    • For resetting cooldowns

The very core of this build is all about indirectly buffing your turrets' DPS . Slowing effects from Mystic Slow and Slowing Bullets give turrets more time to shoot at enemies, while Soul Shredder Bullets and Mystic Vulnerability increase the damage they deal with each shot. Turrets have very low Spirit scaling, so it's better to build these items instead of ones that give higher Spirit bonuses (unless you want to build for McGinnis' Ultimate). Slows also give you a better shot at escaping fights you can't win.

Spirit Lifesteal causes your turrets to heal you when they damage an enemy.

McGinnis' biggest weakness is her low mobility, making her a prime target for a Deadlock hero like Warden. Apart from having no movement skills, she only has two Stamina bars by default , which means she won't be able to roll, double jump, or air-dash as frequently. This build works around that weakness by using Fleetfoot and Superior Stamina . The former gives you a burst of speed when used, while the other grants more Stamina bars to work with.

Deadlock McGinnis Skills And Leveling Order

Skill Name

Effect

Mini Turret (1)

Place a turret that shoots a nearby target or whoever McGinnis shoots with her weapon. Turrets expire after a short time.

  • Turrets inherit 30% of McGinnis's Max HP and 60% of her Spirit Resist.
  • Each turret lasts for 30 seconds

Medicinal Specter (2)

Deploy a field that heals all allies on it.

  • Duration scales based on your Spirit

Spectral Wall (3)

Create a wall to divide the terrain. Upon creation, the wall damages and slows nearby enemies.

  • Press the skill button again to create the wall earlier.
  • The wall cannot be destroyed

Heavy Barrage (4)

Unleash a barrage of rockets that home in on a targeted location.

  • Can be used over a very long range.
  • Cannot be aimed within a minimum range.

Start with Spectral Wall and use it to deny your enemies space and line of sight . Farming Souls is crucial to winning in Deadlock , so try to get the upper hand by preventing your enemy from getting any Souls during the laning phase.

Unlock your skills one by one, and once you start getting more Ability Points, follow this order when you're upgrading your skills:

  • Get the first and second Spectral Wall upgrades
  • Max out Mini Turret
  • Spend one point into Healing Specter
  • Max out Heavy Barrage
  • Max out Spectral Wall
  • Max out Healing Specter

There's plenty of space for improvisation when it comes to upgrading Healing Specter and Heavy Barrage. If you want to push lanes faster, upgrade the latter. If your team is losing and you need a bit more staying power, upgrade the former.

item.title: Best JRPGs For 4-Player Co-Op, Ranked
item.description:
JRPGs have been around for a long time. When a genre survives for so long and is beloved by so many players worldwide despite being decades old, it's a clear sign that there's something special to it. Whether it's turn-based, strategic game mechanics, character upgrading options, or intricate mission design, there's always something fun to experience. It should be noted that, while games like Monster Hunter and Dark Souls have a few traits that could make them pass off as JRPGs, they're not generally considered so, as they lack a few other features to properly fall into that category.

One of the best features a JRPG, or any other game genre can offer, is the possibility to play with friends locally or online. There's just something special about working together with other people to achieve common goals while exploring a fictional world. Here are some of the best JRPGs for 4-player co-op, ranked .

4 White Knight Chronicles

A Tale of Two Kingdoms At War

  • Story based on the long-standing conflict between two kingdoms
  • Up to 4 players can take on different missions and play in Co-op

White Knight Chronicles is set in the middle of a long war between two kingdoms. When a celebration hosted by the king of Balandor is sabotaged by the Magi in an effort to steal an ancient weapon of great power known as the White Knight. In an attempt to save the princess of Balandor, Leonard, the game's main character, releases the power of the White Knight.

This game combines turn-based combat with what could be considered real-time combat. It also allows for character, combos, and skill customization, which is a classic feature in the JRPG genre. White Knight Chronicles allows up to 16 players to log into a lobby, where they can later form parties of 4 players to go on different missions.

3 Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles

A Welcome Addition To The Franchise With Refreshing Real-Time-Based Combat

  • Real-time-based combat mechanics
  • Up to 4-player co-op where one person hosts and 3 others can join

Millions of players worldwide love the Final Fantasy franchise, as it has spawned multiple games across several platforms, many animated movies, and a ton of collectibles for die-hard fans. While not a part of the main series, Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles is a great spin-off that marked the return of the franchise to a Nintendo console since Final Fantasy VI.

As it happens in many other Final Fantasy games, players can take on the role of various characters to explore the world the game is set in. One of the main elements of this game are the Myrrh trees, which are magical and must be found by players as they traverse through the wilderness. Unlike other games in the franchise, this title uses a real-time-based combat mechanic, which is quite refreshing.

2 Tales Of Symphonia Remastered

A New And Improved Version Of A Vintage Classic

  • The remastered version was released 20 years after the original game
  • Simplistic, yet enjoyable combat system

Taking place in the fictional world of Sylvarant , the game follows the story of the main character, Lloyd Irving, as he sets out on a journey to save the world from an unknown threat. Consisting of three major areas and an overworld field map, Tales of Symphonia will have players explore dungeons, caves, and towns in Lloyd's quest to prevent the destruction of Tethe'alla and everyone he loves along with it.

When the game was first released, many critics said the game's combat system felt a little simplistic and clunky, but still enjoyable, as the game mechanics gave it some depth. In 2023, exactly 20 years after the original version was released, Bandai gave players the remastered version, which allows up to 4 players in local Co-op mode.

1 Dragon Quest 9: Sentinels Of The Starry Skies

A Collaborative Game With Character Customization Features

  • Character customization and party member creation features
  • Battle mode alternates between first and third-person views

Set in a world where a race of angels called Celestians are the guardians of the realm of mortals, Dragon Quest 9: Sentinels of the Starry Skies follows the story of the main character, simply known as "The Hero/Heroine". Faced with the opposition of the Gittish Empire , an evil organization thought to be long forgotten, The Hero/Heroine will set out on a journey to gather the last pieces of benevolence to grow Fyggs, a fruit necessary for Celestians to gain access to the Realm of the Almighty.

The game allows players to customize and create the characters in their party, a feature that wasn't present in previous installments of the franchise. While in battle, the game alternates between first and third-person views, allowing for a wider perspective during combat. Players can enjoy Co-op with up to 3 other people, which adds to the experience and makes everything more fun.
